item.title: Google used AI to suspend over 39M ad accounts suspected of fraud
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google on Wednesday said it suspended 39.2 million advertiser accounts on its platform in 2024 — more than triple the number from the previous year — in its latest crackdown on ad fraud. By leveraging large language models (LLMs) and using signals such as business impersonation and illegitimate payment details, the search giant said it could suspend […]

item.title: Visa-backed African unicorn Moniepoint tackles remittances. But is it late to the game?
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: When Visa invested in Nigerian fintech Moniepoint earlier this year, it didn’t just validate the newly minted unicorn — it signaled a bold new direction. As part of that deal, the Nigerian fintech best known for building one of Africa’s largest business banking platforms, hinted at plans to integrate with Visa Direct, a move that […]

item.title: Opera adds its Aria AI assistant to Opera Mini browser
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Norway-based browser company Opera said today that it is making its AI assistant Aria available to Opera Mini users on Android. This move will help users with low-end devices and data constraints access better AI features. Aria AI can help users get the latest news and information on different topics, learn more about various subjects, and […]

item.title: TS Anil, CEO of Monzo, is joining our StrictlyVC London lineup
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: StrictlyVC, the boutique brand powered by TechCrunch and known for evening events that invite headliners into smaller rooms to connect with live audiences, is headed back to London on May 13 — and its latest speaker lineup is one of its strongest yet. Joining the stage is TS Anil, CEO of Monzo Bank, the digital […]

item.title: How Musk manages his growing family: WSJ
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Elon Musk says it’s his duty to “make new humans.” Now, a WSJ investigation suggests he may have fathered more than the 14 children already known, with sources claiming the real number could be significantly higher. The report also describes how Musk keeps those details under wraps. At the center of it all, per the […]

item.title: Grok gains a canvas-like tool for creating docs and apps
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Grok, the chatbot from Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, has gained a canvas-like feature for editing and creating documents and basic apps. Called Grok Studio, the feature was announced on X late Tuesday. It’s available for both free and paying Grok users on Grok.com “Grok can now generate documents, code, reports and browser games,” wrote […]

item.title: Nvidia H20 chip exports hit with license requirement by US government
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Semiconductor giant Nvidia is facing unexpected new U.S. export controls on its H20 chips. In a filing Tuesday, Nvidia said it was informed by the U.S. government that it will need a license to export its H20 AI chips to China. This license will be required indefinitely, according to the filing — the U.S. government […]

item.title: Figma ignores the fear, files paperwork for an IPO
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Design software startup Figma announced Tuesday it has filed its confidential paperwork for an IPO. We won’t know more until that paperwork becomes public, which, best-case scenario would be in about a month. However, with the stock market in groundhog mode — seeing its shadow with every new gyration of the Trump administration’s trade policies […]

item.title: Telli, a YC alum, raises pre-seed funding for its AI voice agents
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description: Former Y Combinator startup Telli is helping companies alleviate the bottleneck that occurs when a high-volume of customers try to, for example, book appointments. Its AI voice agents kick in and handle basic operations while handing off more-complex processes to human operators. The Berlin-based startup has now raised $3.6 million in a pre-seed funding round led […]

item.title: For security, Android phones will now auto-reboot after three days
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The update comes months after Apple pushed its own “inactivity reboot” feature.

item.title: TikTok takes on Google Maps by surfacing reviews in the comments tab
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: As TikTok continues to build out its search experience, the social network is now surfacing reviews for select places right within the comments tab of a video. The new feature, which appears to be a test, eliminates the need to conduct a new search or open Google when you come across a place on TikTok […]

item.title: Stop doomscrolling and watch the ‘Great Moose Migration’ livestream
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: You could say that TikTok is ruining our attention spans, and yet, viewers around the world are tuning in to watch a monotonous livestream from a Swedish TV station that they’ve probably never heard of. It’s time for the Great Moose Migration. For thousands of years, moose have crossed the Ångerman River each spring, trekking […]

item.title: OpenAI may ‘adjust’ its safeguards if rivals release ‘high-risk’ AI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: OpenAI has updated its Preparedness Framework — the internal system it uses to assess the safety of AI models and determine necessary safeguards during development and deployment. In the update, OpenAI stated that it may “adjust” its safety requirements if a competing AI lab releases a “high-risk” system without similar protections in place. The change […]

item.title: India’s BluSmart swept up in Gensol investigation alleging misuse of EV loans
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India’s market regulator launched a probe Tuesday into Gensol Engineering after finding alleged misuse of electric vehicle loans. BluSmart, a ride-hailing startup connected to Gensol that was once seen as an emerging Uber rival in the South Asian market, has also been swept up into the investigation. The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) […]

item.title: Figma sent a cease-and-desist letter to Lovable over the term ‘Dev Mode’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: We may be witnessing the makings of a new tech industry feud between competitors. Figma has sent a cease-and-desist letter to popular no-code AI startup Lovable, Figma confirmed to TechCrunch.  The letter tells Lovable to stop using the term “Dev Mode” for a new product feature. Figma, which also has a feature called Dev Mode, […]

item.title: OpenAI hires team behind GV-backed AI eval platform Context.ai
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Context.ai, a startup building evaluations and analytics for AI models, announced Tuesday that its co-founders will join OpenAI. Context.ai plans to wind down its products following the acqui-hire, per a message on the company’s website. When reached for comment, OpenAI declined to reveal the terms of the deal. “Evals are a requirement to building high-performing […]

item.title: Google bets on geothermal to power data centers in Taiwan
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Swedish company Baseload Capital is developing the project.

item.title: Anthropic forms a new team to grow its AWS business
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: In a sign of Anthropic’s increasingly cozy relationship with Amazon, Anthropic has formed a new team to recruit AWS customers to use its AI products. The team, which Anthropic appears to have begun hiring several months ago, aims to “accelerate” the adoption of Anthropic’s AI among AWS accounts by “building programs that […] scale across […]

item.title: Publishing platform Medium says it’s sticking with DEI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Publishing platform Medium says it’s still committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), even as many other U.S. tech companies have scaled back their efforts in this space to appease the Trump administration. In a blog post published on Monday, Medium CEO Tony Stubblebine backed the company’s diverse community, saying that businesses shouldn’t have to […]

item.title: Google’s Veo 2 video generating model comes to Gemini
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Google is bringing its Veo 2 video-generating AI model to users who pay for Gemini Advanced, the company’s premium AI plan. The expansion comes as Google looks to deliver an answer to OpenAI’s Sora video generation platform, and as competition in the space grows fiercer. Two weeks ago, one of the more formidable synthetic media […]
